result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wendy L. Bloedow

records.addlTxt: 11:28 AM Defendant Wendy L. Bloedow in court.  Attorney John K Smerlinski in court for Wendy L. Bloedow.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 1:  DPA - 12 mo.   Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Defendant sworn by the Clerk. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and defers the sentence accordingly.

10:40 AM Defendant Wendy L. Bloedow in court.  Attorney John K Smerlinski in court for Wendy L. Bloedow.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Request for PLEAS.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.
